email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out with a freight offer for a crude oil shipment from Rotterdam to Singapore. We have a vessel available, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is 25th-30th October. Starting freight rate is in the low 50s, say $50.50 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the offer. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit on the higher side. Given the current market, we were hoping for something in the mid-40s. Can you work on the rate? Also, can you confirm the demurrage terms? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concerns about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $48.75 per metric ton. Demurrage is set at $20,000 per day, pro-rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $48.75 is closer to our target. However, we’d like to push for $47.50. Also, can we extend the laycan to 25th-31st October? This would give us more flexibility. Looking forward to your reply. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve managed to secure $47.75 per metric ton, which is the best I can do. The owner has also agreed to extend the laycan to 25th-31st October. Let me know if this works for you, and I’ll draft the charter party. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $47.75 works for us. Please proceed with drafting the charter party. We’ll review and confirm. Thanks for your efforts on this. Best, John
